description: TO PASS H.R. 1921, (APP. 12-17-03, 1-33 STAT. 34), A BILL FOR CARRYING INTO EFFECT A CONVENTION BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE REPUBLIC OF CUBA, SIGNED DEC. 11, 1902.  (P. 286-1)

TO AMEND A RESOLUTION THAT THE PRESIDENT BE REQUESTED TO INFORM THE SENATE WHETHER ALL THE CORRESPONDENCE AND NOTES BETWEEN THE DEPARTMENT OF STATE AND THE LEGATION OF THE U.S. AT BOGOTA, AND BETWEEN EITHER OF THESE AND THE GOVERNMENT OF COLUMBIA, FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF AN ISTHMIAN CANAL, AND ALL THE CORRESPONDENCE AND NOTES BETWEEN THE U.S. AND ANY OF ITS OFFICIALS OR REPRESENTATIVES OR GOVERNMENT OF PANAMA CONCERNING THE SEPARATION OF PANAMA FROM COLUMBIA, HAVE BEEN SENT TO THE SENATE, AND IF NOT, THAT HE BE REQUESTED TO SEND THE REMAINING CORRESPONDENCE AND NOTES TO THE SENATE IN EXECUTIVE SESSION; AMENDMENT BEING TO ADD TO THE END OF THE RESOLUTION THE WORDS-- "IF NOT, IN HIS JUDGMENT, INCOMPATIBLE WITH THE PUBLIC INTEREST."

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 276 (33 STAT. 175, 4-13-04), A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE CELEBRATION OF THE 100TH ANNIVERSARY OF THE EXPLORATION OF THE OREGON COUNTRY BY LEWIS AND CLARK BY MAKING IT A CONDITION OF THE APPROPRIATIONS PROVIDED BY THIS ACT, THAT THE EXPOSITION THEREIN PROVIDED FOR BE CLOSED ON SUNDAYS.  (P. 1723-2)
TO ADJOURN UNTIL MONDAY, FEB. 15, 1904.
TO RECOMMIT S. 1553, A BILL FOR PAYMENT TO EX-QUEEN LILIUOKALANI OF HAWAII TO THE COMMITTEE ON PACIFIC ISLANDS AND PUERTO RICO.  (P. 1927-2)
TO PASS S. 1553, N.P., A BILL AUTHORISING THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY TO PAY $150,000 TO LILIUOKALANI, FORMERLY QUEEN OF THE KINGDOM OF HAWAII.

TO AMEND THE TREATY CONCERNING THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE PANAMA CANAL, BY AGREEING THAT THE U.S. AND PANAMA MAKE A CERTAIN MONEY PAYMENT TO THE REPUBLIC OF COLUMBIA, AS FULL COMPENSATION FOR THE SURRENDER OF ITS SOVERINGNTY OVER THE TERRITORY EMBRACED IN THE REPUBLIC OF PANAMA, IN PAYMENT OF LAND FOR THE NEW PANAMA CANAL COMPANY AND THE PANAMA RAILROAD COMPANY, AND THE CONSTRUCTION OF A CANAL. (P. 2261-1)

TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF A CONVENTION BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE REPUBLIC OF PANAMA FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF A SHIP CANAL TO CONNECT THE WATERS OF THE ATLANTIC AND PACIFIC OCEANS.  (P. 2261-1)
TO RECOMMIT S. 2263 (APP. 4-28-04, 33 STAT. 518), TO THE COMMITTEE ON COMMERCE.  THE BILL PROVIDES FOR TRANSPORTATION OF SUPPLIES FOR ARMY AND NAVY; NO QUORUM VOTING.
TO RECOMMIT S. 2263.

TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO S. 2263, WHICH AMENDMENT PROPOSED THAT IN CARRYING FREIGHT FOR PUBLIC PURPOSES, THE FREIGHT CHARGES MUST NOT EXCEED MORE THAN TEN PER CENTUM OF THE LOWEST BID OFFERED FOR TRANSPORTING SUCH FREIGHT IN FOREIGN BOTTOMS.

TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO S. 2263, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT ONLY VESSELS OF THE U.S. OR BELONGING TO THE U.S., FROM AND AFTER JULY 1, 1905, SHALL BE EMPLOYED IN THE TRANSPORT- ATION BY SEA, OF COAL, PROVISIONS, FODDER OR SUPPLIES OF ANY DESCRIPTION PURCHASED PURSUANT TO LAW, FOR THE USE OF THE ARMY OR NAVY.  (P. 2461-2)

TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO S. 2263, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES FOR PREFERENCE FOR U.S. SHIPS TO CARRY FREIGHT FOR U.S. ARMY AND NAVY, PROVIDED THE CHARGES ARE NOT MORE THAN 25% IN EXCESS OF FOREIGN RATE.  (P. 2462-1)

TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO S. 2263, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT THE TRADE BETWEEN THE PHILIPPINE ISLANDS AND THE U.S. BE CONTINUED AS AT PRESENT BY SUSPENDING THE APPLICATION OF THE TRADING LAWS OF THE U.S. FOR FIVE YEARS LONGER, UNTIL JULY 1, 1909.
TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO S. 2263, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES FOR THE EXCLUSION, AS EMPLOYEES ON SHIPS ACQUIRING BENEFITS UNDER THIS BILL, OF CHINESE, EXCEPT BONA FIDE RESIDENTS OF THE U.S.
TO AMEND S. 2263, BY INSERTING AT THE END OF SECTION ONE, A PROVISO THAT NONE BUT CITIZENS OF THE U.S. ARE TO BE EMPLOYED ON U.S. VESSELS BENEFITED BY THIS ACT.  (P. 2594-1)

TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO S. 2263, WHICH AMENDMENT FORBIDS FREIGHT CHARGES, PAID FOR TRANSPORTATION IN U.S. VESSELS FROM EXCEEDING BY MORE THAN 100% THE LOWEST BID OFFERED FOR SHIPMENT IN FOREIGN VESSELS.

TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO S. 2263, WHICH AMENDMENT WOULD REQUIRE THE SECRETARIES OF THE ARMY AND NAVY TO REPORT ANNUALLY TO THE PRESIDENT ON THE TRANSPORTATION OF ARMY AND NAVY SUPPLIES AND THE COST OF SUCH TRANSPORTATION BY BOTH FOREIGN AND U.S. VESSELS AND, WHERE PREFERENCE IS GIVEN TO U.S. VESSELS AT A HIGHER COST, TO SUBMIT TO THE PRESIDENT, FOR TRANSMISSION TO CONGRESS, THE REASON FOR SUCH PREFERENCE.  (P. 2596-2)

TO AMEND S. 2259, (APP. 4-15-04, 33 STAT. L. 181), A BILL REGULATING SHIPPING IN THE TRADE OF THE U.S. WITH THE PHILIPPINES, AND THE TRADE WITHIN THE PHILIPPINE ARCHIPELAGO, BY EXTENDING FROM JULY 1, 1904, TO JULY 1, 1909, THE TIME LIMIT FOR THE APPLICATION OF THE COASTWISE LAWS OF THE U.S. TO THE TRADE BETWEEN THE PHILIPPINES AND THE U.S. WHICH MAKE IT UNLAWFUL TO SHIP FREIGHT OR TRANSPORT PASSENGERS IN VESSELS NOT OWNED OR REGISTERED IN THE U.S.  (P. 2601-1)

TO TABLE AMENDMENT TO S. 2259, (APP. 4-15-04,33 STAT. L 181) CONCERNING SHIPPING BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE PHILIPPINES, WHICH SEEKS TO EXTEND FROM JULY 1, 1905, TO JULY 1, 1906, THE TIME WHEN ALL PASSENGERS AND MERCHANDISE TRANSPORTED BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE PHILIPPINES SHALL BE LIMITED TO U.S. SHIPS.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 12446, (4-21-04, 33 STAT. 234) A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR FORTIFICATIONS SO THAT THE AMENDMENT STIPULATES THAT THE SECRETARY OF WAR WILL BE ENABLED TO PURCHASE ONE SUBMARINE TORPEDO BOAT FOR EXPERIMENTAL PURPOSES, PROVIDED THAT, THE SUBMARINE IS FULLY TESTED AND SUITABLE FOR COASTAL DEFENSE.
TO AMEND H.R. 12446, BY PROVIDING THAT THE SECRETARY OF WAR MAY PURCHASE ONE SUBMARINE FOR EXPERIMENTAL PURPOSES. (P. 3217-2)

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 12446, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT THE SECRETARY OF WAR MAY PURCHASE A SUBMARINE FOR EXPERIMENTAL PURPOSES, PROVIDED THAT ONLY AMERICAN INVENTOR OR OWNER OF SUCH TYPE BOAT BE GIVEN AN OPPORTUNITY TO TEST SAME BY COMPARISON OR COMPETITION, AND THE RESULTS REPORTED TO THE SECRETARY OF WAR.  (P. 3292-1)
TO PROVIDE THAT THE INJUNCTION OF SECRECY BE REMOVED FROM THE PROCEEDINGS ON THE NOMINATION OF BRIGADIER GENERAL LEONARD A. WOOD TO BE A MAJOR GENERAL IN THE U.S. ARMY.

TO AMEND H.R. 12684 (4-21-04, 33 STAT. 189), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE INDIAN DEPARTMENT FOR FISCAL 1905, BY STIPULATING THAT J. HALE SYPHER BE PAID OUT OF THE FUNDS IN THE U.S. TREASURY BELONGING TO THE CHOCTAW NATIONS, $25,000, WHICH THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY IS AUTHORIZED TO PAY UPON RECEIPT OF ALL CLAIMS AGAINST THE CHOCTAWS FOR SERVICES AND EXPENSES AS ATTORNEY FOR THEM UNDER CONTRACT OF NOV. 7, 1891, BETWEEN SYPHER AND THE CHOCTAWS.  (P. 3561)
TO AMEND H.R. 13521, (APP. 4-28-04, 33 STAT. L. 429), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR SERVICE OF POST OFFICE DEPT. FOR FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1902, FOR OTHER PURPOSES. (P. 4484-1)
TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 13521, WHICH AMENDMENT PROPOSES TO CREATE A COMMISSION OF THREE SENATORS AND FIVE REPRESENTATIVES TO INVESTIGATE THE STATUS OF THE U.S. POSTAL LAWS.  (P. 4676-2)
TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 13521, WHICH AMENDMENT SEEKS TO CREATE A COMMISSION OF 5 SENATORS TO INVESTIGATE THE STATUS OF THE U.S. POSTAL LAWS.

TO TABLE A SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT TO S. 5342, (APP. 4-28-04), (33 STAT. L. 429), A BILL PROVIDING FOR TEMPORARY GOVERNMENT OF THE CANAL ZONE AND THE PROTECTION OF THE CANAL WORKS, THUS STOPPING ACTION ON THE PROPOSAL TO PAY THE REPUBLIC OF PANAMA TEN MILLION DOLLARS FOR CERTAIN OF ITS TERRITORY FOR CANAL CONSTRUCTION AND FOR CANAL ZONE.

TO PASS A RESOLUTION THAT THE COMMITTEE ON INTEROCEANIC CANALS IS DISCHARGED FROM THE FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF THE FOLLOWING RESOLUTION, AND THAT THE SAME BE BROUGHT BEFORE THE SENATE FOR CONSIDERATION; I.E.-  "THAT THE ATTORNEY GENERAL IS HEREBY DIRECTED TO INFORM THE SENATE, AT HIS EAR- LIEST CONVENIENCE, OF THE PRESENT STATE OF THE NEGOTIATION OR AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE NEW PANAMA CANAL COMPANY AND THE GOVERNMENT OF THE U.S., TOGEHTER WITH A COPY OF ANY AGREEMENT OR AGREEMENTS THAT HAVE BEEN MADE OR PROPOSED BY SAID PARTIES, OR EITHER OF THEM TOUCHING THE SALE OF THE PROPERTY OF THE SAID CANAL COMPANY, SINCE MARCH 11, 1903; AND THAT HE ALSO TRANSMIT TO THE SENATE COPIES OF ALL PAPERS RELATING THERETO THAT ARE OR HAVE BEEN IN HIS POSSESSION AND UNDER HIS CONTROL, SO AS TO INFORM THE SENATE FULLY AS TO THE ENTIRE TRANSACTION.  (P. 4852-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 11128 (APP. 4-27-04, 33 STAT. 319), A BILL TO MODIFY AND AMEND AN AGREEMENT WITH THE INDIANS OF THE DEVILS LAKE RESERVATION, IN N.C., TO ACCEPT AND RATIFY THE SAME AS AMENDED, AND MAKING APPROPRIATION AND PROVISION TO CARRY THE SAME INTO EFFECT, AMENDMENT PROPOSING TO MAKE THE PRICE OF LAND ACQUIRED FROM THE INDIANS, TWO DOLLARS AND FIFTY CENTS PER ACRE, BUT ACTUAL SETTLERS ON THE LAND SHALL RECEIVE A PATENT FOR THEIR LAND UPON THE PAYMENT TO THE LOCAL LAND OFFICE OF THE USUAL FEE AND COMMISSIONS, AFTER THE PERIOD REQUIRED BY LAW.  (P. 4914-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 14416, (APP. 4-28-04, 33 STAT. L. 452), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR SUNDRY CIVIL EXPENSES OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1905, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES, BY PROVIDING FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF A FIREPROOF BUILDING FOR THE USE OF THE SENATE, NOT TO EXCEED $2,500,000.00 IN COST.  (P. 4869-1)

TO STRIKE OUT AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 14416, (APP. 4-28-04, 33 STAT. 452), MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR SUNDRY CIVIL EXPENSES OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR FISCAL 1905, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDED FOR THE EXTENSION AND COMPLETION OF THE CAPITOL BUILDING ACCORDING TO PLANS, AND THE APPROPRIATION OF $75,000 FOR THIS PURPOSE.
TO PROCEED WITH CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1700, N.P., A BILL RELATIVE TO RELIEF OF THE ESTATE OF WARREN MITCHELL.

TO DECIDE A POINT OF ORDER; WHETHER AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 13860 (APP. 4-28-04, 33 STAT. 441), THE MILITARY ACADEMY APPROPRIATION BILL, IS GERMANE.  THE AMENDMENT WOULD AUTHORIZE THE SECRETARY OF WAR TO ESTABLISH FOUR PERMANENT CAMP GROUNDS AND ENLARGE THE CHICKAMAUGA NATIONAL PARK FOR THE INSTRUCTION AND MANEUVERS OF THE REGULAR ARMY AND NATIONAL GUARD TROOPS.

TO AMEND H.R. 14623, (APP. 2-6-05, 33 STAT. L. 689) AN ACT TO AMEND SEVERAL ACTS REGARDING THE CIVIL GOVERNMENT OF THE PHILIPPINE ISLANDS, BY ELIMINATING THAT PART OF SECTION ONE, WHICH PROPOSES TO MAKE ALL BONDS TAX EXEMPT ISSUED BY THE PHILIPPINE GOVERNMENT, OR UNDER ITS AUTHORITY.

TO AMEND H.R. 14623, BY PROPOSING TO HAVE THE PHILIPPINE GOVERNMENT GUARANTEE THE INTEREST ON RAILROAD BONDS AT THE RATE OF 3% INSTEAD OF 4% PER YEAR, AND TO REDUCE THE ANNUAL CONTINGENT LIABILITY FROM $1,200,000 TO $900,000. (P. 360-1)

TO AMEND H.R. 14623, AUTHORIZING THE GENERAL GOVERNMENT OF THE PHILIPPINE ISLANDS THE RIGHT OF REGULATING CHARGES FOR FREIGHT AND PASSENGER SERVICE ON RAILROAD COMPANIES WHOSE INTEREST ON BONDS IS GUARANTEED; AND BEFORE ANY RAILROAD COMPANY CAN ISSUE ANY STOCKS OR BONDS, SAME MUST BE APPROVED BY THE PHILIPPINE COMMISSION.  (P. 360-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 14623, BY AUTHORIZING THE PHILIPPINE GOVERN- MENT TO GUARANTEE, NOT EXCEEDING FOUR PER CENT PER ANNUM, THE INTEREST ON BONDS OF ANY RAILROAD COMPANY, AUTHORIZED BY THE PHILIPPINE GOVERNMENT TO BUILD AND EQUIP RAILROAD, THE GUARANTEE OF INTEREST TO LAST THIRTY YEARS.  (P. 348-1)

TO AMEND H.R. 14623, (APP. 2-6-05), BY RELEASING THE U.S. GOVERNMENT FROM LIABILITY ON BONDS THAT MAY BE ISSUED BY THE GOVERNMENT OF THE PHILIPPINES, OR BY ANY MUNICIPAL OR OTHER SUB-DIVISION THEREOF, UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF THE ACT.

TO AMEND H.R. 14623, BY ELIMINATING AMENDMENT WHICH PROPOSED TO AUTHORIZE THE PHILIPPINE GOVERNMENT TO GUARANTEE FOR THIRTY YEARS, NOT EXCEEDING FOUR PER CENT PER ANNUM, THE INTEREST ON BONDS OF ANY RAILROAD COMPANY AUTHORIZED BY THE PHILIPPINE GOVERNMENT TO BUILD AND EQUIP A RAILROAD.

TO AMEND H.R. 14623, BY ADDING A NEW SECTION PROPOSING THAT ONE-HALF OF THE ENTIRE UNAPPROPRIATED PUBLIC DOMAIN IN THE SAID ISLAND IS HEREBY SET APART AS A PERMANENT SCHOOL FUND FOR THE INHABITANTS OF THE PHILIPPINES.

TO PROCEED TO THE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 14749, A BILL TO ENABLE THE PEOPLE OF OKLAHOMA AND OF THE INDIAN TERRITORY TO FORM A CONSTITUTION AND STATE GOVERNMENT AND BE ADMITTED INTO THE UNION ON AN EQUAL FOOTING WITH THE ORIGINAL STATES; AND TO ENABLE THE PEOPLE OF N.M. AND OF ARIZ. TO FORM A CONSTITUTION AND STATE GOVT., AND BE ADMITTED INTO THE UNION ON AN EQUAL FOOTING WITH THE ORIGINAL STATES.  (P. 442-1)

TO RECOMMIT TO THE COMMITTEE ON TERRITORIES, H.R. 14749, A BILL ENABLING THE PEOPLE OF OKLAHOMA, AND THE INDIAN TERRITORY COMBINED TO FORM A STATE GOVERNMENT AND THE PEOPLE OF N.M. AND ARIZ. COMBINED TO FORM A STATE GOVERNMENT EACH TO BE ADMITTED INTO THE UNION ON AN EQUAL FOOTING WITH THE ORIGINAL STATES.  (P. 444-2)
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF WILLIAM D. CRUM, TO THE POST OF COLLECTOR OF CUSTOMS FOR THE PORT OF CHARLESTON, S.C.

TO DECIDE A POINT OR ORDER, H.R. 15895, (APP. 2-3-05, 33 STAT. L. 631), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE LEGISLATURE EXECUTIVE AND JUDICIAL EXPENSES OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR THE FISCAL YEAR JUNE 30, 1906 AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.  (P. 753-1, JP. 74)
TO PASS S. 535, FOR THE RELIEF OF CHARLES. R. HOOPER, TO AUTHORIZE AND DIRECT THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY TO PAY CLAIMANT OR HIS HEIRS $50 MONTHLY FOR SIXTY MONTHS; NO QUORUM VOTING.  (P. 790)
TO PASS S. 535, FOR THE RELIEF OF CHARLES R. HOOPER, AUTHOR- IZING THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY TO PAY TO SAID HOOPER OR HIS HEIRS $50 PER MONTH FOR A PERIOD OF SIXTY MONTHS.
TO PROCEED TO CONSIDERATION OF S. 2833, A BILL TO AUTHORIZE THE EXTENTION, CONSTRUCTION, AND OPERATION OF THE GREAT FALLS AND OLD DOMINION RAILROAD INTO THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.  (P. 905-1)

TO AMEND H.R. 17094, (APP. 3-3-05, 33 STAT. L. 845), A BILL APPROPRIATING FOR FORTIFICATIONS AND OTHER WORKS OF DEFENSE AND FOR ARMAMENT THERE OF, FOR THE PROCUREMENT OF HEAVY ORDINANCE FOR TRIAL AND SERVICE; BY ELIMINATING THAT PART OF THE BILL PROPOSING TO APPROPRIATE THE SUM OF $700,000 FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF SEA COAST BATTERIES, AND THE SUM OF $120,000 FOR THE PURCHASE, MANUFACTURE, TEST AND ISSUE OF A SEA COAST CANNON FOR COASTAL DEFENSE IN THE INSULAR POSSESSIONS, ALSO TO ELIMINATE THE PROVISO, AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARY OF WAR TO MOUNT TWO TWELVE INCH, AND THREE TEN INCH BREECH LOADING RIFLES AND TWO TWELVE INCH AND TWO TEN INCH RIFLES FOR THE CARRIAGES FOR WHICH ESTIMATES ARE NOW SUBMITTED.  (P. 1227-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 17094, (APP. 3-3-05, 33 STAT. L. 845), A BILL APPROPRIATING FOR FORTIFICATIONS AND OTHER WORKS OF DEFENSE AND FOR ARMAMENT THERE OF, FOR THE PROCUREMENT OF HEAVY ORDINANCE FOR TRIAL AND SERVICE; BY ELIMINATING THAT PART OF THE BILL RPOPOSING TO APPROPRIATE THE SUM OF $700,000 FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF SEA COAST BATTERIES, AND THE SUM OF $120,000 FOR THE PURCHASE, MANUFACTURE, TEST AND ISSUE OF A SEA COAST CANNON FOR COASTAL DEFENSE IN THE INSULAR POSSESSIONS, ALSO TO ELIMINATE THE PROVISO, AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARY OF WAR TO MOUNT TWO TWELVE INCH, AND THREE TEN INCH BREECH LOADING RIFLES AND TWO TWELVE INCH AND TWO TEN INCH RIFLES FOR THE CARRIAGES FOR WHICH ESTIMATES ARE NOW SUBMITTED.  (P. 1227-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 14749, A BILL TO ENABLE THE PEOPLE OF OKLAHOMA INDIAN TERRITORY, N.M. AND ARIZ. TO FORM A CONSTITUTION AND STATE GOVERNMENT AND BE ADMITTED INTO THE UNION ON AN EQUAL FOOTING WITH THE ORIGINAL STATES, BY INSERTING AS PART OF THE CONSTITUTION OF THE PROPOSED NEW STATE CONSISTING OF THE PEOPLE OF OKLA. AND INDIAN TERRITORY, A SECTION WHICH WOULD MAKE IT A MISDEMEANOR PUNISHABLE BY FINE AND IMPRISONMENT TO MANUFACTURE, SELL, BARTER OR GIVE AWAY ANY INTOXICATING BEVERAGE THIS SECTION TO BE IN EFFECT FOR 21 YEARS AFTER ADMISSION OF SAID STATE.  (P. 1970-2,1974-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 14749, BY INSERTING AS PART OF THE CONSTITUT- ION OF THE PROPOSED NEW STATE CONSISTING OF THE PEOPLE OF OKLAHOMA AND INDIAN TERRITORY, A SECTION WHICH WOULD MAKE IT A MISDEAMOR PUNISHABLE BY FINE AND IMPRINSONMENT TO MANUFACTURE, SELL, BARTER OR GIVE AWAY ANY INTOXICATING BEVERAGE, THIS SECTION TO BE IN EFFECT FOR 21 YEARS AFTER ADMISSION OF SAID STATE.  (P. 1970-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 14749, BY STRIKING OUT CERTAIN SECTIONS INCLUSIVE AND INSERTING NEW SECTIONS IN LIEU THEREOF, PROPOSING A NEW STATE TO BE CALLED NEW MEXICO, BUT LEAVING OUT ALL REFERENCE TO THE TERRITORY OF ARIZONA, ON THE GROUND THAT THERE WERE ENOUGH PEOPLE IN THE TERRITORY OF NEW MEXICO TO FORM A STATE WITHOUT INCLUDING ARIZONA. (P. 1984-1,1992-1)

TO AMEND H.R. 14749, BY STRIKING OUT ALL AFTER THE ENACTING CLAUSE, UP TO THE AMENDMENT JUST ADOPTED AND IN LIEU THEROF INSERT A NEW AMENDMENT FOR THE ADMISSION OF OKLAHOMA AS ONE STATE, OMITTING THE INDIAN TERRITORY AS PART OF OKLAHOMA. (P. 1995-2,1997-1)

TO TABLE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 14749, WHICH PROPOSED TO SUBMIT TO A DIRECT VOTE OF THE PEOPLE OF EACH TERRITORY THE QUESTION OF MAKING ONE STATE OUT OF THE TERRITORY OF OKLAHOMA AND THE INDIAN TERRITORY, REQUIRING A MAJORITY VOTE IN BOTH TERRITORIES TO MAKE ONE STATE OF BOTH TERRITORIES. (P. 1997-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 14749, BY ADDING A PROVISO TO ANNEX THAT PORTION OF ARIZONA TERRITORY LYING NORTH AND WEST OF THE CENTER OF THE COLORADO RIVER TO FORM A PART OF THE STATE OF UTAH, WITH ITS CONSENT.  (P. 2000-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 14749, BY STRIKING OUT ALL OF CERTAIN SECTIONS AND INSERTING NEW SECTIONS IN LIEU THEREOF, PROPOSING THAT A NEW STATE BE MADE OUT OF THE TERRITORY OF NEW MEXICO BUT LEAVING OUT ALL REFERENCE TO THE TERRITORY OF ARIZONA, ON THE GROUND THAT THERE ARE ENOUGH EPOPLE IN N.M. TO FORM A STATE WITHOUT INCLUDING THE TERRITORY OF ARIZ.  (P. 1984-1)

TO AMEND H.R. 14749, BY ELIMINATING FROM THE BILL EVERYTHING RELATING TO STATEHOOD FOR N.M. AND ARIZ., RETAINING IN THE BILL, SECTIONS WHICH PROPOSED TO FORM A NEW STATE OUT OF OKLAHOMA AND INDIAN TERRITORIES.  (P. 2001-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 14749, BY STRIKING OUT THE WORDS WHICH PROHIBIT THE PROPOSED STATE OF N.M. FROM ENACTING ANY LAW RESTRICTING OR ABRIDGING THE RIGHT OF SUFFRAGE ON ACCOUNT OF RACE, COLOR, OR PREVIOUS SERVITUDE, COMMENCING WITH SECTION 19 OF BILL.  (P. 2004-1)

TO TABLE THE MOTION WHICH PROPOSED TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE OF THE SENATE WHICH AGREED TO AMENDMENT TO H.R. 14749, SAID AMENDMENT ELIMINATING THE CLAUSE WHICH PROVIDED THAT THE NEW PROPOSED STATE OF N.M. SHALL NEVER ENACT ANY LAW RESTRICTING THE RIGHT OF SUFFRAGE ON ACCOUNT OF RACE, COLOR, OR PREVIOUS CONDITION OF SERVITUDE.  (P. 2004-1)

TO AMEND H.R. 18329, (APP. 3-3-05, 33 STAT. L. 681), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE FOR YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1906, BY STRIKING OUT, ON PAGE 40, LINE 16, AFTER THE WORD "COUNTRIES", THE CLAUSE ENABLING THE SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE TO ESTABLISH STANDARDS OF PURITY FOR FOOD PRODUCTS AND DETERMINE WHAT ARE REGARDED AS ADULTERATIONS THEREIN, FOR THE GUIDANCE OF THE OFFICIALS OF THE VARIOUS STATES AND THE COURTS OF JUSTICE.  (P. 2454-2)

TO DECIDE THE ADMISSIBILITY OF EVIDENCE IN THE IMPEACHMENT TRIAL OF CHARLES SWAYNE, JUDGE OF THE U.S. DISTRICT COURT IN AND FOR THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF FLORIDA, HELD BEFORE THE SENATE SITTING AS A COURT; WHICH EVIDENCE CONSTITUTES THE COPY OF A STATEMENT MADE BY SWAYNE BEFORE THE HOUSE COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIARY ON NOVEMBER 28, 1904, REGARDING HIS RESIDENCE IN HIS JUDICIAL DISTRICT IN FLORIDA, AND WHICH WAS OFFERED IN EVIDENCE BY MR. PALMER, ONE OF THE HOUSE MANAGERS.
TO AMEND THE ARBITRATION TREATY WITH FRANCE, BY ELIMINATING THE WORDS "AGREEMENT" AS REFERRED TO IN DOCUMENT AND INSERTING THE WORD "TREATY", THEREBY MAKING THE DOCUMENT A TREATY.  (P. 204-1)

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 18329, (APP. 3-3-05, 33 STAT. L. 861), A BILL APPROPRIATING FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1906, BY ADDING A CLAUSE PROHIBITING REBATES ON IMPORTS WHICH, WHEN BLENDED WITH DOMESTIC PRODUCTS, ARE INCAPABLE OF BEING MECHANICALLY OR ANALYTICALLY SEPARATED OR DETERMINED.  (P. 2523-1)

TO CLOSE THE SENATE DOORS IN THE IMPEACHMENT TRIAL OF U.S. DISTRICT COURT JUDGE ALBERT SWAYNE OF THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF FLORIDA, WHILE DECIDING UPON THE ADMISSIBILITY OF EVIDENCE OFFERED BY MR. DE ARMOND, ONE OF THE HOUSE MANAGERS, CONSISTING OF CERTAIN VOLUNTARY STATEMENTS MADE BY SWAYNE BEFORE THE HOUSE JUDICIARY COMMITTEE HEARING UPON HIS RESIDENCE IN NORTHERN FLORIDA AND UPON CERTAIN CONTEMPT PROCEEDINGS IN WHICH HE DELIBERATED AS U.S. DISTRICT COURT JUDGE IN NORTHERN FLORIDA.

TO DECIDE THE ADMISSIBILITY OF EVIDENCE IN THE IMPEACHMENT TRIAL OF CHARLES SWAYNE, U.S. DISTRICT COURT JUDGE IN AND FOR THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF FLORIDA; WHICH EVIDENCE, CONSTITUTES VOLUNTARY STATEMENTS MADE BY SWAYNE BEFORE THE HOUSE JUDICIARY COMMITTEE CONCERNING HIS RESIDENCE IN THE JUDICIAL DISTRICT TO WHICH HE HAD BEEN APPOINTED JUDGE AND CONCERNING CERTAIN CONTEMPT PROCEEDINGS IN WHICH HE DILIBERATED AS U.S. DISTRICT COURT JUDGE IN NORTHERN FLORIDA.

TO AMEND H.R. 16986, A BILL REGARDING CONSTRUCTION OF THE PANAMA CANAL AND TO PROVIDE FOR THE GOVERNMENT OF THE CANAL ZONE BY LIMITING THE USE OF VESSELS FOR THE CONSTRUCTION AND OPERATION OF THE CANAL AND ITS RAILROAD, TO U.S. SHIPS ONLY; NO QUORUM VOTING.

TO DECIDE THE ADMISSIBILITY OF EVIDENCE IN THE IMPEACHMENT TRIAL OF CHARLES SWAYNE, JUDGE OF THE U.S. DISTRICT COURT IN AND FOR THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF FLORIDA; WHICH EVIDENCE, OBJECTED TO BY THE HOUSE MANAGERS, IS OFFERED BY DEFENSE COUNSEL IN THE FORM OF EXTRACTS FROM THE CONGRESSIONAL RECORD DELINEATING, AS PART OF THE PARLIAMENTARY HISTORY OF THE ENACTMENT OF LAWS, THE LEGAL CONSTRUCTION TAKEN IN THE MATTER OF COMPENSATION ALLOWED TO U.S. CIRCUIT AND DISTRICT COURT JUDGES.

TO DECIDE THE ADMISSIBILITY OF EVIDENCE IN THE IMPEACHMENT TRIAL OF CHARLES SWAYNE, U.S. DISTRICT COURT JUDGE IN AND FOR THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF FLORIDA, WHICH EVIDENCE, OFFERED BY DEFENSE COUNSEL AND ATTESTED BY THE SECRETARY OF TREASURY AS A TRUE STATEMENT FROM TREASURY BOOKS, BUT NOT UNDER SEAL, PURPORTS TO SHOW EXPENSE CLAIMS OF U.S. CIRCUIT COURT JUDGES ALLOWED WHILE ATTENDING COURTS AWAY FROM THEIR RESIDENCES OR OUT OF THEIR OWN DISTRICTS.

TO DECIDE THE GUILT OR INNOCENCE OF CHARLES SWAYNE, U.S. DISTRICT COURT JUDGE IN AND FOR THE NORTHER DISTRICT OF FLORIDA, OF THE CHARGES IN THE FIRST ARTICLE OF IMPEACHMENT AGAINST HIM WHICH DECLARES THAT SWAYNE ON 4/20/1897, PRE- SENTED TO U.S. MARSHAL R.M. LOVE IN WACO, TEXAS, A FALSE CLAIM OF $230 AGAINST THE U.S. WHILE U.S. DISTRICT COURT JUDGE FOR NORTHERN FLA., ALSO KNOWINGLY MADE AND USED A FALSE CERTIFICATE FACILITATING PAYMENT OF HIS CLAIM.

TO DECIDE THE GUILT OR INNOCENCE OF CHARLES SWAYNE, U.S. DISTRICT COURT JUDGE IN AND FOR THE NORTHERN DIST. OF FLA. TO THE SECOND ARTICLE OF IMPEACHMENT WHICH DECLARES THAT HE FALSELY CERTIFIED THAT HIS REASONABLE EXPENSES FOR TRAVEL AND ATTENDENCE AMOUNTED TO THE MAXIMUM ALLOWED, $10 PER DAY FOR 24 DAYS WHILE HOLDING COURT AT TYLER, TEXAS, BEGINNING DEC. 3, 1900, AND FOR 7 DAYS ENROUTE TO AND FROM FLORIDA, AND UPON HIS CERTIFICATE, TO THE U.S. MARSHAL IN WHICH THE COURT WAS HELD, HE RECEIVED $310, WHEREAS HIS EXPENSES WERE LESS THAN $10 PER DAY, AND THAT, THEREFORE, HE MISBEHAVED AND IS GUILTY OF THE HIGH CRIME OF OBTAINING MONEY FROM THE U.S. UNDER FALSE PRETENSE, COMMITTING A HIGH MISDEMEANOR IN OFFICE.

TO DECIDE THE GUILT OR INNOCENCE OF CHARLES SWAYNE, U.S. DISTRICT COURT JUDGE IN AND FOR THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF FLA., OF THE CHARGES IN THE 3RD ARTICLE OF IMPEACHMENT AGAINST HIM WHICH DECLARES THAT AS A U.S. JUDGE HE FALSELY CERTIFIED HIS REASONABLE TRAVEL EXPENSES TO AND FROM TYLER, TEXAS, WERE $310, WHICH HE RECEIVED FROM A U.S. MARSHAL, WHEN HIS EXPENSES ACTUALLY WERE MUCH LESS, WHEREFORE HE IS GUILTY OF A HIGH MISDEMEANOR IN OFFICE CONSTITUTED BY HAVING OBTAINED MONEY FROM THE U.S. BY FALSE PRETENSE.

TO DECIDE THE QUILT OR INNOCENCE OF CHARLES SWAYNE, U.S. DISTRICT COURT JUDGE IN AND FOR THE NORTHERN DIST. OF FLA., OF THE CHARGES IN THE 4TH ARTICLE OF IMPEACHMENT AGAINST HIM WHICH DECLARES THAT HE, AS A U.S. JUDGE IN 1893, UNLAWFULLY APPROPRIATED TO HIS OWN USE A RAILROAD CAR OF THE JACKSONVILLE, TAMPA AND KEY WEST RAILROAD COMPANY FOR TRANSPORTING HIMSELF, FAMILY AND FRIENDS FROM GUYENCOURT, DEL. TO JACKSONVILLE, FLA., WHEN THE RAILROAD WAS IN THE HANDS OF A RECEIVER, UNDER A CLAIM OF RIGHT BECAUSE HE APPOINTED THE COMPANY'S RECEIVER, WHEREFORE HE IS GUILTY OF ABUSE OF JUDICIAL POWER AND OF A HIGH DEMEANOR IN OFFICE.

TO DECIDE THE GUILD OR INNOCENCE OF CHARLES SWAYNE, U.S. DISTRICT COURT JUDGE IN AND FOR THE NORTHEN DISTRICT OF FLA., OF THE CHARGES IN THE FIFTH ARTICLE OF IMPEACHMENT AGAINST HIM WHICH ACCUSES HIM, AS A U.S. JUDGE IN 1893, OF UNLAWFULLY APPROPRIATING FOR USE OF HIMSELF, FAMILY AND FRIENDS, A RAILROAD CAR OF THE JACKSONVILLE, TAMPA AND KEY WEST RAILROAD COMPANY, UNDER A CLAIM OF RIGHT BECAUSE HE HAD APPOINTED THE COMPANY'S RECEIVER, WHEREFORE HE IS GUILTY OF ABUSE OF JUDICIAL POWER AND OF HIGH MIS- DEMEANOR IN OFFICE.

TO DECIDE THE GUILT OR INNOCENCE OF CHARLES SWAYNE, U.S. DISTRICT COURT JUDGE IN AND FOR THE NORTHERN DIST. OF FLA. OF THE CHARGES IN THE 6TH ARTICLE OF IMPEACHMENT AGAINST HIM DECLARING THAT HE, AS U.S. JUDGE FROM THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF FLORIDA, ESTABLISHED HIS HOME IN ST. AUGUSTINE ON APRIL 22, 1890, BUT FAILED TO MOVE WHEN ON JULY 23, 1894 ST. AUGUSTINE WAS PLACED IN THE SOUTHERN DISTRICT, AND THAT HE LIVED, IN VIOLATION OF LAW, OUTSIDE THE DISTRICT HE SERVED AS JUDGE, FOR SIX YEARS, WHEREFORE HE WAS AND IS GUILTY OF A HIGH MISDEMEANOR IN OFFICE.

TO DECIDE THE GUILT OR INNOCENCE OF CHARLES SWAYNE, U.S. DISTRICT COURT JUDGE IN AND FOR THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF FLORIDA, OF THE CHARGES IN THE 7TH ARTICLE OF IMPEACHMENT AGAINST HIM DECLARING THAT AS A U.S. JUDGE FOR NORTHERN DISTRICT OF FLORIDA AND KNOWING THE LAW REQUIRED HIM TO LIVE IN THAT DISTRICT, HE LIVED FROM JULY 23, 1894 TO JAN. 1, 1903 OTHER THAN IN THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF FLORIDA, THUS WILLFULLY AND KNOWINGLY VIOLATING THE LAW, WHEREFORE HE IS AND WAS GUILTY OF A HIGH MISDEMEANOR IN OFFICE.

TO DECIDE THE GUILT OR INNOCENCE OF CHARLES SWAYNE, U.S. DISTRICT COURT JUDGE IN AND FOR THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF FLORIDA, OF THE CHARGE IN THE 8TH ARTICLE OF IMPEACHMENT AGAINST HIM DECLARING THAT ON NOVEMBER 12, 1901, HE MALICIOUSLY AND UNLAWFULLY ADJUDGED E.T. DAVIS, A LAWYER, GUILTY OF CONTEMPT OF COURT, FINING HIM $100 AND COMMITTING HIM TO JAIL FOR TEN DAYS, WHEREFORE HE IS GUILTY OF A HIGH MISDEMEANOR IN OFFICE.

TO DECIDE THE GUILT OR INNOCENCE OF CHARLES SWAYNE, U.S. DISTRICT COURT JUDGE IN AND FOR THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF FLORIDA, OF THE CHARGE IN THE 9TH ARTICLE OF IMPEACHMENT AGAINST HIM DECLARING THAT ON NOV. 12, 1901, HE KNOWINGLY AND UNLAWFULLY ADJUDGED E.T. DAVIS, A LAWYER, GUILTY OF CONTEMPT OF COURT, FINING HIM $100 AND COMMITTING HIM TO JAIL FOR TEN DAYS, WHEREFORE HE MISBEHAVED AS JUDGE AND WAS AND IS GUILTY OF ABUSE OF JUDICIAL POWER AND OF A HIGH MISDEMEANOR IN OFFICE.

TO DECIDE THE GUILT OR INNOCENCE OF CHARLES SWAYNE, U.S. DISTRICT COURT JUDGE IN AND FOR THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF FLORIDA, OF CHARGE IN THE TENTH ARTICLE OF IMPEACHMENT AGAINST HIM DECLARING THAT ON NOV. 12, 1901, HE MALICIOUSLY AND UNLAWFULLY ADJUDGED SIMEON BELDEN, A LAWYER, GUILTY OF CONTEMPT OF THE U.S. CIRCUIT COURT, FINING HIM $100 AND JAILING HIM FOR TEN DAYS, WHEREFORE HE MISBEHAVED AS JUDGE AND IS AND WAS GUILTY OF ABUSE OF JUDICIAL POWER AND OF A HIGH MISDEMEANOR IN OFFICE.

TO DECIDE THE GUILT OR INNOCENCE OF CHARLES SWAYNE, U.S. DISTRICT COURT JUDGE IN AND FOR THE NORTHER DISTRICT OF FLA., OF THE CHARGES IN THE 11TH ARTICLE OF IMPEACHMENT AGAINST HIM DECLARING THAT WHILE HE WAS A U.S. JUDGE ON NOVEMBER 12, 1901, HE KNOWINGLY AND UNLAWFULLY ADJUDGED SIMEON BELDEN, A LAWYER, GUILTY OF CONTEMPT OF THE U.S. CIRCUIT COURT, FINING HIM $100 AND JAILING HIM FOR TEN DAYS, WHEREFORE HE MISBEHAVED AS JUDGE AND WAS AND IS GUILTY OF ABUSE OF THE JUDICIAL POWER AND OF A HIGH MISDEMEANOR IN OFFICE.

TO DECIDE THE GUILT OR INNOCENCE OF CHARLES SWAYNE, U.S. DISTRICT COURT JUDGE IN AND FOR THE NORTHERN DIST. OF FLA., FLORIDA, TO CHARGE IN THE TWELFTH ARTICLE OF IMPEACHMENT AGAINST HIM DECLARING THAT ON DEC. 9, 1902, WHILE A U.S. JUDGE, HE UNLAWFULLY AND KNOWINGLY COMMITTED W.C. O'NEAL TO JAIL FOR 60 DAYS FOR CONTEMPT OF THE U.S. DISTRICT COURT FOR THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF FLORIDA, WHEREFORE HE MISBEHAVED AS JUDGE AND WAS AND IS GUILTY OF ABUSE OF THE JUDICIAL POWER AND OF A HIGH MISDEMEANOR IN OFFICE.

TO AMEND H.R. 18467, (APP. 3-3-05, 33 STAT. L. 1092), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR NAVAL SERVICE FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1906 AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES, REDUCING THE NUMBER OF BATTLESHIPS TO BE BUILT FROM TWO TO ONE; MOTION REJECTED.

TO DECIDE THE POINT OF ORDER THAT THE AMENDMENT PROPOSING THAT NO PORTION OF THE FUNDS APPROPRIATED BY THIS ACT OR THE PRINCIPAL OR INTEREST OF ANY INDIAN TRUST OR TRIBAL FUND HELD BY THE U.S. FOR THE BENEFIT OF ANY INDIAN TRIBE SHALL USED FOR THE SUPPORT OF ANY SECTARIAN OR DENOMINATIONAL SCHOOL, PROVIDED THAT ANY BENEFICIARY OF ANY INTEREST IN SUCH FUNDS, DESIRING TO EDUCATE HIS CHILD OR WARD IN ANY OTHER SCHOOL, OTHER THAN GOVERNMENT, MAY BE A WRITTIN ORDER SIGNED BY HIM, DIRECT THE INTEREST ACCURING TO HIM, TO BE PAID TO THE SCHOOL IN WHICH SUCH CHILD MAY BE EDUCATED-, IS NOT RELEVANT OR GERMANE TO THE SUBJECT MATTER OF H.R. 17474, (APP. 3-3-05, 33 STAT. L. 1048), APPROPRIATING FOR THE CURRENT AND CONTINGENT EXPENSES OF THE INDIAN DEPARTMENT AND FOR FULFILLING TREATY STIPULATIONS WITH INDIAN TRIBES FOR YEAR EIDING JUNE 30, 1906.
TO AMEND H.R. 17474, BY GIVING THE INDIAN THE RIGHT TO DECIDE WHETHER ANY PART OF HIS SHARE OF THE TRIBAL INTEREST FUND COULD BE USED FOR THE EDUCATION OF HIS CHILD, CHILDREN OR WARD.  (P. 3622-1)

TO SUSTAIN THE DECISION OF THE CHAIR DURING CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 17474, WHICH DECISION RULED AS NOT BEING IN ORDER, AN AMENDMENT PROPOSING THAT CLAIMANTS TO CITIZENSHIP IN THE FIVE CIVILIZED TRIBES WHO ARE OF INDIAN BLOOD, WHOSE NAME ARE ON TRIBAL ROLLS AS CITIZENS AND WHOSE CLAIMS HAVE BEEN REJECTED OR MAY BE BY THE COMMISSIONER TO THE FINE CIVILIZED TRIBES, SHALL HAVE RIGHT FOR NINETY DAYS FROM THE APPROVAL OF THIS ACT, OR FOR NINETY FROM THE APPROVAL OF SUCH REJECTION BY THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR, TO SELL THEIR IMPROVEMENTS UPON THE LANDS WHICH THEY HAVE OCCUPIED AS THEIR HOMES OR HELD FOR ALLOTMENTS FOR THEIR MINOR CHILDREN, TO OTHER CITIZENS OF SUCH TRIBE HAVING LAWFUL RIGHT TO ACQUIRE THE SAME, BUT IN N  CASE SHALL THIS PRIVILEGE EXTEND TO AN AREA OF MORE THAN STANDARD ALLOTMENT FOR EACH PERSON.  (P. 3683-2)

TO AGREE TO THE FIRST DIVISION OF AMENDMENT TO H.R. 17865, (APP. 3-3-05, 33 STAT. L. 1082), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIAT- IONS FOR THE SERVICE OF THE POST OFFICE DEPARTMENT FOR YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1906, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES, WHICH AMENDMENT INCREASES THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE TRANSMISSION OF MAIL BY PNEUMATIC TUBES AND OTHER SIMILAR DEVICES FROM $500,000.00 TO $800,000.  (P. 3731-2,3732-2)

TO AMEND THE FIRST DIVISION OF THE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 17865, (APP. 3-3-05, 33 STAT. L. 1082), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE SERVICE OS THE POST OFFICE DEPARTMENT FOR YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1906, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES WHICH AMENDMENT RAISING THE APPROPRIATION FOR PNEUMATIC MAIL TUBES AND OTHER SIMILAR DEVICES FROM $500,000 TO $800,000 AND AUTHORIZING THE POSTMASTER GENERAL TO EXTEND THE SERVICE UNDER THE ACT OF APRIL 21, 1902.
TO PASS S.J.RES. 114, PROPOSING TO CONTINUE IN FORCE THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION 2 OF AN ACT TO PROVIDE FOR THE TEMPORARY GOVERNMENT OF THE CANAL ZONE AT PANAMA, APRIL 28, 1904.
TO PROCEED TO CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 12273 (APP. 3-3-05, 33, STAT. L. 1263), A BILL AUTHORIZING THE APPOINTMENT OF CERTAIN MIDSHIPMEN IN THE U.S. NAVY.
